title: Ultrahuman’s new flagship smart ring has a 15-day battery
summary: Ultrahuman has launched its third-generation Ring Pro smart ring with up to 15 days of battery life and 250 days of on-device health history storage, representing significant improvements over its 2023 predecessor which offered only 4-6 days of battery life. The Ring Pro comes with an enhanced charging case that extends total battery life to 45 days, and the company is also upgrading its health monitoring platform with a new 'biointelligence AI' integration.
content:
The Ultrahuman Ring Pro comes with a snazzy Pro Charging Case for up to 45 days of additional battery life. | Image: Ultrahuman	

Ultrahuman is expanding its health monitoring ecosystem with the launch of a new flagship smart ring and a "biointelligence AI" platform upgrade. The Ring Pro is Ultrahuman's third-generation smart ring, and promises up to 15 days of battery life before needing to recharge, alongside 250 days of on-device health history storage.
Those are some significant improvements compared to its predecessor, the 2023 Ring Air, which provides 4-6 days of battery life and several days of offline data storage, according to user estimates. fr.title: Le nouvel anneau intelligent phare d'Ultrahuman a 15 jours d'autonomie

La Ring Pro est fournie avec un étui de recharge amélioré qui prolonge l'autonomie totale de la batterie à 45 jours, et la société met également à niveau sa plateforme de surveillance de la santé avec une nouvelle intégration d'« IA biointelligence ».

de.title: Ultrahuman's neuer Flaggschiff-Smartring hat 15 Tage Akkulaufzeit
de.summary: Ultrahuman hat seinen Smart Ring Ring Pro der dritten Generation mit bis zu 15 Tagen Akkulaufzeit und 250 Tagen Speicherung von Gesundheitsverlauf auf dem Gerät eingeführt, was erhebliche Verbesserungen gegenüber seinem Vorgänger aus 2023 darstellt, der nur 4-6 Tage Akkulaufzeit bot. Der Ring Pro wird mit einem verbesserten Ladecase geliefert, das die Gesamtakkulaufzeit auf 45 Tage verlängert, und das Unternehmen aktualisiert auch seine Gesundheitsüberwachungsplattform mit einer neuen „Biointelligenz-KI"-Integration.

es.title: El nuevo anillo inteligente insignia de Ultrahuman tiene 15 días de batería

El Ring Pro viene con un estuche de carga mejorado que extiende la duración total de la batería a 45 días, y la empresa también está mejorando su plataforma de monitoreo de salud con una nueva integración de "IA biointeligencia".

title: Phones are going to get weird next week
summary: Mobile World Congress is expected to showcase numerous innovative and unconventional phones and devices from manufacturers worldwide, particularly Chinese companies and niche makers, breaking away from the increasingly uniform smartphone market. The event will feature everything from modular phones to devices with unusual specifications and extraordinary features.
content:
Honor’s Robot Phone is set to make an appearance, and this time we might actually see it switched on. | Photo: Dominic Preston / The Verge	

With rare exceptions, phones are pretty boring these days. The good news is, a boatload of those rare exceptions are about to show up at once, courtesy of Mobile World Congress.
The tech industry's biggest mobile show may not quite have the clout it once did, when the likes of Samsung, Sony, LG, and HTC showcased new flagships there each year, but it still attracts more phone launches than CES does two months earlier. It's especially popular with the Chinese manufacturers who are still fighting for space in the global market, along with niche manufacturers who turn up with extra-durable "rugged" devices, or battery beasts that are more powe …
Read the full story at The Verge.

title: MWC 2026: all the phones, gadgets, and announcements from Barcelona
summary: Mobile World Congress 2026 in Barcelona will feature major announcements from leading technology companies including Xiaomi, Honor, Samsung, Google, and Nothing, with expected introductions of cutting-edge smartphones, tablets, and wearables. The show is expected to showcase both established products and experimental devices, continuing the tradition of featuring unusual designs and innovative technologies.
content:
The Verge is heading to Barcelona, Spain, for Mobile World Congress, the biggest phone show of the year.
CES may dominate the headlines when it comes to TVs, computer components, and AI inanity, but for all things mobile, MWC has it beat. Since it’s a global show, that includes all manner of announcements of phones, tablets, and wearables that won’t necessarily release in the US.
Xiaomi has already teased a European launch for its 17 and 17 Ultra flagships, Honor is promising not only its Robot Phone but a full pivot to humanoid robotics, and Nothing is almost certain to drop more details on its Phone 4A ahead of a planned London launch on March 5th.
The likes of Samsung and Google will be there too, but mostly to talk about the already-announced 10A and S26 models, while Apple is launching something during the same week as MWC, but not actually in Barcelona.
We’ll also be looking out for oddities. Last year featured camera phone concepts with detachable lenses,  a Lenovo laptop with a folding screen, and an Infinix handset with a solar panel in its back. We’ll be hoping this year gets just as weird.
Keep this page bookmarked for all the news, commentary, and first looks from the show floor.

title: Ultrahuman bets on redesigned smart ring to win back U.S. market after Oura dispute

The Ring Pro offers 15 days of battery life, representing a significant improvement in the competitive smart ring category.
content: Ultrahuman’s Ring Pro promises 15-day battery life and a $479 price tag as the wearables maker expands its health-tech push.

title: Plaid valued at $8B in employee share sale
summary: Payment infrastructure company Plaid achieved an $8 billion valuation in an employee share sale, marking a 31% increase from its previous $6.1 billion valuation reached in April. The milestone demonstrates investor confidence in Plaid's growing market position in payment technology.
content: The new valuation is a 31% increase from $6.1 billion Plaid reached in April.

Cette étape démontre la confiance des investisseurs dans la position de marché croissante de Plaid dans la technologie des paiements.

Este hito demuestra la confianza de los inversores en la posición de mercado creciente de Plaid en tecnología de pagos.
